name: DuplicateAsanaTask
description:
Create a job to duplicate a task in Asana.

This tool creates and returns a job that will asynchronously handle the duplication of a specified task in Asana. It should be called when there's a need to copy an existing task.

parameters.name: task_gid
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the task to duplicate in Asana.

parameters.name: optional_fields_to_include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of optional properties to include in the response.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: new_task_name
parameters.description: The name for the newly duplicated task in Asana.

value_schema.description: The name of the new task.

parameters.name: fields_to_duplicate
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of task fields to duplicate, such as assignee, attachments, dates, etc.

value_schema.description:
A comma-separated list of fields that will be duplicated to the new task.
##### Fields
- assignee
- attachments
- dates
- dependencies
- followers
- notes
- parent
- projects
- subtasks
- tags

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable pretty printing of the JSON response for improved readability. Use this primarily for debugging as it increases response size and time.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: opt_fields
parameters.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: data.name
parameters.description: The name of the new task.

value_schema.description: The name of the new task.
